Bibliographic Ghosts: London, British Library Harley 3362: not in this manuscript.
_description: A proverbial saying, translating ‘Calceus ignescit quando pes igne calescit’ — one couplet

BodRawD328.Transcription: When þe wote warmydthan þe scho harmyd
BodRawD328.Note:
Translating ‘Cum pes calessit…’, which
                    precedes; English portion all written on one line.
BodRawD328.Editions:
Meech,  Sanford Brown. 
             “A Collection of Proverbs in Rawlinson MS D 328.” 
             Modern Philology
         38 (1940-41): 113-32: 122.

OxfBal354.Transcription: While the fote warmiththe shoe harmith

         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).

                        ed.

                Richard Hill’s Commonplace Book.
EETS
          e.s. 101 (1908); repr. 1984: 128.

RylandsLat394.Transcription: When þe foote warmesþan þe sho harmys
